This example demonstrates the flexibility of the plot_data() function outputs,
  through customisation of its own arguments as well as addition of ggplot
  elements.


```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)
```

```{r setup}
library(censusnz)
```

```{r fig.align = 'center', fig.height = 7, fig.width = 7}
my_plot <- plot_data("WARD", c("maori_descent", "smoking_status"), n = 6)
my_plot
```

We can change colours and labels and generally make any adjustments you would
normally expect of `ggplot` objects.

```{r fig.align = 'center', fig.height =7, fig.width = 7}
my_plot + ggplot2::scale_fill_brewer(palette="Paired") +
  ggplot2::ggtitle("2018 Census Results by Ward")
```
